item.title: New World Ends Development Following Amazon Layoffs
item.content:encoded:
Following the Amazon layoffs, New World is stopping development and ending with Season 10 and the recent Nighthaven update. The news comes after more than 14,000 were let go from Amazon and its affiliates like Twitch.

Released in 2021 on PC and in 2024 for consoles, New World, also known as New World Aeternum, is an MMORPG from Amazon Games. It was revealed as one of three titles announced to be in development for Amazon. New World was the only one to succeed, despite abandoning its original free-to-play entry. Unfortunately, the game’s journey will stop here, unfortunately ending development and future updates.

New World Ending with Season 10 After Amazon Layoffs, Servers Shutting Down After 2026

In a statement from the New World team on the official website, development on the game has ended. The recent Season 10 and Nighthaven update, which launched earlier this month, are the final updates. In the blog, the team states,

After four years of steady content updates and a major new console release, we’ve reached a point where it is no longer sustainable to continue supporting the game with new content updates. The recently launched Season 10 and Nighthaven update will serve as the final content release for New World on PC and consoles. It is only after much consideration that we’ve reached this decision.

Both the Nighthaven and Rise of the Angry Earth updates are now free for fans on PC and Aeternum will remain on PS+ Premium and Extra for the time being. Servers for New World will remain open through 2026, with more information regarding the game’s future to be revealed at a later date.

While not stated in the blog, the team was hit with multiple firings due to today’s massive-scale Amazon layoff. A report from Bloomberg, which we wrote on, said that Amazon’s game studios were hit hard. Specifically, the layoffs were felt hardest for teams developing MMOs, like Amazon Game Studios. Sadly, this will likely be the first of many bad news stories surrounding the topic, as the studios were working on multiple new titles that are now in jeopardy.

item.title: Complete Battlefield 6 REDSEC DLC Trophy List—How To Get All Achievements & Trophies
item.content:encoded:
We received a welcome treat with the launch of Battlefield 6’s REDSEC content, as it included a new DLC trophy list specifically for battle royale and Gauntlet content. Insider Gaming has the full list for you to check out, and for something so short, it’s deceptively grindy.

Once we got wind of the Battlefield 6 trophy list, we’d have been forgiven for thinking this would be the extent of BF 6’s trophies. Alas, we were wrong, and we’re glad to say we were. The REDSEC battle royale content was introduced with Season 1, and so with it came the awesome new Gauntlet mode.

Gauntlet and traditional BR make up the fabric of the new Battlefield 6 trophies and achievements, so let’s check them out.

All Battlefield 6 REDSEC DLC Trophies & Achievements

The extra Battlefield 6 DLC REDSEC trophy list is like a 3ft powerlifter—Small in stature, but doing a lot of heavy lifting. There aren’t many trophies and achievements here, but they will take you a long time to achieve.

Here’s the complete list of DLC REDSEC trophies for Battlefield 6.

How Many Achievements & Trophies In Battlefield 6 REDSEC DLC?

There’s a small helping of 11 extra PlayStation Trophies and 11 Xbox Achievements to explore, discover, and obtain in Battlefield 6’s optional REDSEC DLC list.

Quite often, when we do these lists, we have to give Xbox owners the bad news that PS users get an additional trophy. This isn’t the case this time around! DLC trophy lists don’t carry a Platinum, so it’s a level playing field for once.

If you are on PS5, it’s broken down into 10 Bronze Trophies and 1 Silver Trophy. Happy hunting, soldiers.
